title-group.article-title: Effects of Capacitive Bus Loading on J1850 Vehicle Networks

permissions.copyright-statement: Copyright 1995 Society of Automotive Engineers, Inc.

abstract.p: Capacitive overloading of SAE J1850 vehicle communications networks will cause a change in the time constant for a particular network causing it to fall out of specification. Addition of transient voltage protection devices to communications nodes increases a node's capacitive load on a system causing the overall network time constant to change. Other capacitive components commonly encountered in a communications network will also change the network's time constant, causing it to fail or to behave erratically. Component selection plays an important role in maintaining the correct capacitive loading on a SAE J1850 network in order to adhere to the physical layer characteristics of both PWM and VPW protocols.

ref.mixed-citation: Society of Automotive Engineers, "SAE J2201 Recommended Practice -Universal Interface For OBD II Scan Tool," November 1992, pp A4 -A14.
Society of Automotive Engineers, "SAE Standard J1 850 -Class Ð’ Data Communication Network Interface," March 9, 1994, p 18.
S. Cherniak, "A Review of Transients and Their Means of Suppression," Motorola Semiconductor, Application Note AN843 Rev.1.
Harris Semiconductor, "Transient Voltage Protection Devices," 1990, pp 9-52, 9-53.
Motorola Semiconductor, "TVS/Zener Device Data," First Edition, 1991, pp 6-4-17 to 6-4-22
